sentence.text: The importance of PKC enzymes in Purkinje neuron health is apparent as mutations in phosphorylation (encoding PKCÎ³) cause cerebellar ataxia.

Using mouse models of spinocerebellar ataxia type 1 (negative regulation of transcription, DNA-templated) and 2 (SCA2) we identify an increase in PKC-mediated substrate phosphorylation in two different forms of inherited cerebellar ataxia.
